item.title: Kurnool bus fire accident: Gadwal Govt Hospital sends medical team, hospital on standby for emergency admissions
item.description:
<![CDATA[The Government General Hospital (GGH) in Telangana’s Jogulamba Gadwal district has dispatched a medical team to assist in emergency response efforts following a fatal bus accident in Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh, in the early hours of Friday (October 24, 2025).
Speaking to The Hindu, Indira, Superintendent of GGH Gadwal, said that while no injured persons had been brought to the Gadwal hospital so far, a team from Gadwal Medical College was sent immediately to the accident site to support t...]]>
item.author: Authors

item.title: Kurnool bus fire accident: Telangana’s Gadwal Collector announces control room numbers
item.description:
<![CDATA[Telangana’s Gadwal District Collector B.M. Santosh on Friday (October 24, 2025) announced control room numbers for families of victims of the accident in Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, in which a private bus went up in flames killing several people.
Control room numbers Gadwal Collectorate control room : 9502271122 Gadwal Collectorate helpdesk numbers: 1) 9100901599, 2) 9100901598 Gadwal Police control room number : 8712661828 Kurnool Government General Hospital control room number : 9100901604
Besi...]]>
item.author: Authors

item.title: Senior Maoist Leader Surrenders Before DGP
item.description:
<![CDATA[Hyderabad: Claiming health complications, 62-year-old Maoist central committee member Pothula Padmavathi alias Sujatakka, wife of the late Maoist leader Mallojula Koteshwar Rao alias Kishanji, surrendered before the Telangana police on Saturday after spending 43 years underground.
Director General of Police (DGP) Jitender handed her a `25 lakh demand draft, equivalent to the bounty on her head.
Padmavathi, a native of Penchikalpadu village in Gattu mandal of Jogulamba Gadwal district, held key...]]>
item.author: Mouli Mareedu, About The Author
